intro: Draba leptophylla, commonly known as the slender-leafed whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. Draba leptophylla has a compact, low-growing habit with basal leaves that are narrow and linear. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, making it a notable species in alpine flora.
